intro: Borreria compacta, commonly known as the Mexican heather, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. This shrub typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually white or pink, often blooming in spring and summer. Borreria compacta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
